name: Communicable disease threats to public health in the EU
Dengue
cmt: one commercial vaccine actually exosts, but is not commonly used for various reasons

name: Ebola and Marburg virus diseases (filovirus)
cmt: on commercial vaccine for Ebola exists and is being used, but none for Marburg

name: Healthcare-associated infections in intensive care units
Hantavirus infection
cmt: commervial vaccine available for HTNV but not for other hantaviruses

name: Malaria
cmt: vaccine quite new, endorsed by WHO since 2021

name: Plague
cmt: multiple vaccines exist and have been used in practice, but not formally approved

name: Rift Valley fever
cmt: at least one vaccine was approved in the US, but not widely available. Animal vaccines available

name: Tularaemia
cmt: rabbit fever, apparently there was a vacine available but is currently under review for undeclared reasons (US CDC)

name: Enteritis due to Yersinia enterocolitica or Yersinia pseudotuberculosis
